homes_hear_details: Ohio has not yet launched its HOMES or HEAR rebate programs under the Inflation Reduction Act. The Ohio Development Services Agency - Office of Community Development is the designated state entity coordinating with the U.S. Department of Energy on program planning.
state_energy_office: Ohio Development Services Agency - Office of Community Development

income_thresholds.low_income_80_ami: For Ohio, 80% of Area Median Income varies by county. In Franklin County (Columbus), 80% AMI for a family of four is approximately $65,200. In Cuyahoga County (Cleveland), it is approximately $59,700.
income_thresholds.moderate_income_150_ami: For Ohio, 150% of Area Median Income varies by county. In Franklin County (Columbus), 150% AMI for a family of four is approximately $122,250. In Cuyahoga County (Cleveland), it is approximately $111,900.

net_metering: Ohio has net metering rules for customer-owned generating facilities up to the customer's load. Customers receive credit at the retail rate for excess generation, carried forward to subsequent billing periods. Ohio law requires all electric distribution utilities to offer net metering.

state_rebate_programs.name: Home Weatherization Assistance Program (HWAP)
state_rebate_programs.amount: Average expenditure of approximately $7,200 per home
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Insulation, air sealing, heating system repair or replacement, windows, doors, health and safety improvements
state_rebate_programs.details: Federally funded program for income-qualifying households at or below 200% of federal poverty level. Administered through local community action agencies across Ohio.

state_rebate_programs.name: Home Energy Assistance Program (HEAP)
state_rebate_programs.amount: One-time assistance payment varies by household size and income
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Heating and cooling bill assistance for income-qualifying households
state_rebate_programs.details: Provides assistance with energy bills for eligible low-income Ohio residents. Eligibility is based on income at or below 175% of the federal poverty level.

programs.name: AEP Ohio Energy Efficiency Rebates
programs.amount: Up to $500 for heat pumps, $300 for smart thermostats and insulation, $50-$200 for ENERGY STAR appliances
programs.eligible_items: High-efficiency HVAC systems, heat pumps, smart thermostats, insulation, ENERGY STAR appliances, heat pump water heaters

programs.name: AEP Ohio Home Energy Assessment
programs.amount: Free in-home or online energy assessment
programs.eligible_items: Comprehensive home energy evaluation with energy-saving recommendations

programs.name: Duke Energy Smart $aver Rebates
programs.amount: Up to $600 for heat pumps, $200 for smart thermostats, $300 for insulation
programs.eligible_items: High-efficiency heat pumps, central air conditioners, smart thermostats, attic insulation, duct sealing

top_utilities.name: FirstEnergy Ohio (Ohio Edison, The Illuminating Company, Toledo Edison)

programs.name: Residential Energy Efficiency Programs
programs.amount: Varies by measure; rebates for qualifying equipment
